titleStmt.title: Kentucky Institute for the Feeble Minded

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: Kentucky Institute for the Feeble Minded

body.p: Located in Frankfort, Kentucky. Established by an act of the Kentucky General Assembly on February 11, 1860 and signed into law by Governor Beriah Magoffin.

bibl.p: "An Act to establish a Institution for the education of idiots and feeble-minded children," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort, Ky.: J. B. Major, State Printer, 1860), 23-25.
